Entries.default: "Can I ask you something personal?"
"Ekera. Do not hold back, my friend."
"You sure? Sometimes I ask things that get people riled up without meaning to."
"If it riles me up, then I say you have my undivided attention."
"All right. Is there any kind of ocean critter I shouldn't be eating in front of you?"
"I notice the Huana got a lot of statues of Ondra."
"Ekera. Mother Ngati is much beloved."
"That doesn't bother you?"
"Should it? What say?"
"Well if everybody in my village had a naked statue of my mama, I'd be knocking on doors and making threats."
"Tekēhu, you ever use your abilities to play jokes on anyone?"
"Ekera, I once sold a water globe to a Mataru priest. It was filled with live fish."
"Doesn't sound like much of a joke."
"The trick was letting the sculpture break down while he slept with it over his head."
"I'm getting so many ideas right now. How would you feel about betraying the Watcher's trust?"
"You think Ondra's got something in mind for you, Tekēhu?"
"For me to exist in this form and to join this crew... I know she does."
"It's funny, I fought against Eothas. I'm chasing him now. And I don't think he knows a thing about me."
"Ekera. It is for us to show the gods why we are worthy of notice."
"Yeah. I guess we'll still see about that."
"Pallegina, how is it nothing about what the gods are up to seems to faze you?"
"When you think the worst of them, the worst they can do comes as little surprise."
"Don't you at least wanna hear what Eothas has to say?"
"Only a fool would trust what he had to say. Whatever he said would be just another lie."
"I- I'm not saying it wouldn't. Just looking for... I dunno."
"Hey Pallegina, I know your kind, you can't have children. But... would you have wanted them?"
"Ac. It is because I cannot give my country children that I give them so much of the life I have."
"When I was younger I took it for granted I'd have 'em one day - free labor."
"But a lot of time passed before I knew it. Hardly gave it a thought until now."
"You're not getting any younger. I know you don't like thinking, Edér, but maybe it's time to start."
"Deadfire's so different than what I'm used to. Must be for you, too."
"Ac. Quite different. Even I am not accustomed to this much sailing."
"They, uh, they seem to hold the godlike in high regard. You ever think about staying?"
"The ducs have liberated me from the burden of making that choice, Edér."
"Did Kana ever get to meet Ishi?"
"Briefly. It didn't go well."
"Really? Kana always seemed agreeable to me."
"You weren't there for the White Flood."
"Does it suit you, being a soldier? I did well enough at it, but it was never for me."
"I like knowing that someone has a plan. Never felt it from the gods."
"You ever think, maybe I put my faith in the wrong cause?"
"Ishi can purge his whole intestine at once if he's feeling ornery. Kana never wore that hat again."
"Faith is what you feel in a given moment. Like a bird's feathers, it molts from time to time."
"So if things had played out different, you might've grown up here."
"True. Good thing my parents had the sense to leave."
"And you'd be worrying about what the trading companies were doing, setting up down here."
"No offense, but I try not to live with a bunch of 'ifs' trailing in my wake."
"Serafen, thought we agreed you'd stay out of my head."
"I weren't in your head, lad. You think like an ogre snores. I'd be a fool and a half not to make sure them thoughts ain't full up of trouble."
"What do you think you're gonna find?"
"Nothing particular. Just... anything."
"All right, which one of us am I thinking of now?"
"You be thinking of the Watcher."
"That's ten in a row! That's some talent you got."
"Aye. The talent of noticing who you be glancing at before you ask me who you be thinking of."
"The answer be no, you fathom-headed farmer."
"I- I didn't ask anything."
"Nothing sides wondering if orlan brains, being smaller than fat farmer brains like your own, have it harder for ciphering."
"Uh, I wasn't wondering that."
"The answer be no."
"Cone cat! Cooone cat!"
"Hey little snake! Ssssss!"
"Who's a good wurm? Who's a good wurm?"
"Sooey! Soooooey! Oink, oink, oink."
"Sssssssssssssnakey!"
"You hungry little fella? Want some honey?"
Edér clicks his tongue. "Kitty, kitty!"
Edér whistles at the dog.
"Look at that little bear belly."
"Hey pupper."
